trans-unit.source: Get started with a Javascript mobile app after adding Mobile Services by using Visual Studio Connected Services | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Get started with a Javascript mobile app after adding Mobile Services by using Visual Studio Connected Services | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to get started with Mobile Services in a JavaScript project in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: How to get started with Mobile Services in a JavaScript project in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: Getting Started with with a Javascript mobile app after adding Azure Mobile Services by using Visual Studio Connected Services
trans-unit.target: Getting Started with with a Javascript mobile app after adding Azure Mobile Services by using Visual Studio Connected Services

trans-unit.source: The first step you need to do in order to follow the code in these examples depends on what type of mobile service you connected to.
trans-unit.target: The first step you need to do in order to follow the code in these examples depends on what type of mobile service you connected to.

trans-unit.source: For a JavaScript backend mobile service, create a table called TodoItem.
trans-unit.target: For a JavaScript backend mobile service, create a table called TodoItem.

trans-unit.source: To create a table, locate the mobile service under the Azure node in Server Explorer, right-click the mobile service's node to open the context menu, and choose **Create Table**.
trans-unit.target: To create a table, locate the mobile service under the Azure node in Server Explorer, right-click the mobile service's node to open the context menu, and choose **Create Table**.

trans-unit.source: Enter "TodoItem" as the table name.
trans-unit.target: Enter "TodoItem" as the table name.

trans-unit.source: If instead you have a .NET backend mobile service, there's already a TodoItem table in the default project template that Visual Studio created for you, but you need to publish it to Azure.
trans-unit.target: If instead you have a .NET backend mobile service, there's already a TodoItem table in the default project template that Visual Studio created for you, but you need to publish it to Azure.

trans-unit.source: To publish it, open the context menu for the mobile service project in Solution Explorer, and choose **Publish Web**.
trans-unit.target: To publish it, open the context menu for the mobile service project in Solution Explorer, and choose **Publish Web**.

trans-unit.source: Accept the defaults, and choose the **Publish** button.
trans-unit.target: Accept the defaults, and choose the **Publish** button.

trans-unit.source: Get a reference to a table
trans-unit.target: Get a reference to a table

trans-unit.source: The client object was added to your project already.
trans-unit.target: The client object was added to your project already.

trans-unit.source: Its name is the name of your mobile service with "Client" appended to it.
trans-unit.target: Its name is the name of your mobile service with "Client" appended to it.

trans-unit.source: The following code gets a reference to a table that contains data for a TodoItem, which you can use in subsequent operations to read and update the data table.
trans-unit.target: The following code gets a reference to a table that contains data for a TodoItem, which you can use in subsequent operations to read and update the data table.

trans-unit.source: Add an entry
trans-unit.target: Add an entry

trans-unit.source: Insert a new item into a data table.
trans-unit.target: Insert a new item into a data table.

trans-unit.source: An id (a GUID of type string) is automatically created as the primary key for the new row.
trans-unit.target: An id (a GUID of type string) is automatically created as the primary key for the new row.

trans-unit.source: Don't change the type of the id column, since the mobile services infrastructure uses it.
trans-unit.target: Don't change the type of the id column, since the mobile services infrastructure uses it.

trans-unit.source: Read/query a table
trans-unit.target: Read/query a table

trans-unit.source: The following code queries a table for all items, updates a local collection and binds the result to the UI element listItems.
trans-unit.target: The following code queries a table for all items, updates a local collection and binds the result to the UI element listItems.

trans-unit.source: You can use the where method to modify the query.
trans-unit.target: You can use the where method to modify the query.

trans-unit.source: Here's an example that filters out completed items.
trans-unit.target: Here's an example that filters out completed items.

trans-unit.source: For more examples of queries you can use, see [query object](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj613353.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more examples of queries you can use, see [query object](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj613353.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Update an entry
trans-unit.target: Update an entry

trans-unit.source: Update a row in a data table.
trans-unit.target: Update a row in a data table.

trans-unit.source: In this example, *todoItem* is the updated item, and *item* is the same item as returned from the mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this example, *todoItem* is the updated item, and *item* is the same item as returned from the mobile service.

trans-unit.source: When the mobile service responds, the item is updated in the local todoItems list using the [splice](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh700810.aspx) method.
trans-unit.target: When the mobile service responds, the item is updated in the local todoItems list using the [splice](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh700810.aspx) method.

trans-unit.source: Call the **done** method on the returned [Promise](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn802826.aspx) object to get a copy of the inserted object and handle any errors.
trans-unit.target: Call the **done** method on the returned [Promise](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn802826.aspx) object to get a copy of the inserted object and handle any errors.

trans-unit.source: Delete an entry
trans-unit.target: Delete an entry

trans-unit.source: Delete a row in a data table.
trans-unit.target: Delete a row in a data table.

trans-unit.source: Call the [done]() method on the returned [Promise](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn802826.aspx) object to get a copy of the inserted object and handle any errors.
trans-unit.target: Call the [done]() method on the returned [Promise](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn802826.aspx) object to get a copy of the inserted object and handle any errors.
